Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; part of rosette in added white above zigzag band between white lines; exterior: painted decoration consisting of male figure (sandaled feet with black dots and white soles remaining) to right; below in handle zone, guilloche pattern between dilute lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Williams suggests that the sherd is by the Aphaia Painter and compares the processional scene with British Museum 1888,0601.493.i, 1888,0601.493.l and with a chalice from Aegina (Williams 1983 157-160 figs.1-2).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0811) (phase 2)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 160)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 79 (Other Accession Number)
